pullRequest.title: Add BBE for deprecation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
Create a new title for documentation, move existing documentation to that file and add new doc for deprecation

nodes.bodyText: Instead of saying basic_documentations, shall we rename it to basic_documentation?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
 # To run this sample, navigate to the directory that contains the
 # `.bal` file, and execute the `ballerina run` command.
-$ ballerina run documentation.bal
+$ ballerina run basic_documentations.bal

@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+// The constant 'CONST1' is deprecated using '@deprecated' annotation and markdown documentation '# # Deprecated'

nodes.bodyText: Instead of using names like CONST1, CONST2, Foo, DummyObject, shall we try and come up with a more practical and complete example?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@

+# Define a constant
+# # Deprecated
+# This constant is deprecated
+@deprecated
+const string CONST1 = "CONST1";
+const string CONST2 = "CONST2";

+// In Ballerina, type definitions, functions, object methods and constants can be deprecated using the @deprecated annotation.

@@ -0,0 +1,4 @@
+// In Ballerina, type definitions, functions, object methods and constants can be deprecated using the @deprecated annotation.
+// The compiler will generate warnings if a user uses a deprecated construct. If the deprecated construct contains documentation,
+// the user has to add some additional bit of documentation called `Deprecated` documentation.

@@ -0,0 +1,4 @@
+// In Ballerina, type definitions, functions, object methods and constants can be deprecated using the @deprecated annotation.
+// The compiler will generate warnings if a user uses a deprecated construct. If the deprecated construct contains documentation,
+// the user has to add some additional bit of documentation called `Deprecated` documentation.
+// The `Deprecated` documentation should ideally include details on why the construct was deprecated and suitable alternate options which should be used instead.

+// The constant `CITY` is marked as deprecated using the `@deprecated` annotation and the markdown documentation `# # Deprecated`.

nodes.bodyText:
This line is not consistent with L25. S
e.g.,
type Address vs Address type
Shall we fix?
initializer itself is not deprecated right?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            "name": "Basic documentations",
          
          
            
                            "url": "basic-documentations"

commit.message: Add depreaction and create new title for doc

nodes.bodyText: These two constant names, they actually sound like variable names. Shall we rename them to something like "CMB" and "LK"? Just so that they sound like constants defined to represent a particular constant value.
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
Shall we align the start of this line with the start of parameters in the above line?
May have to break this into 2 lines.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+import ballerina/io;
+
+// The constant `LKA` is marked as deprecated using the `@deprecated` annotation.
+// Since it has documentation, the `# # Deprecated` documentation needs to be added as well.
+// This will appear in the generated documentation.
+# Country code for Sri Lanka.
+# # Deprecated
+# This constant is deprecated. Use the constant `LK` instead.
+@deprecated
+public const string LKA = "LKA";
+
+# New country code for Sri Lanka.
+public const string LK = "LK";
+
+# Country code for USA.
+public const string USA = "USA";
+
+// The type definition contains both the deprecated constant and its replacement.
+public type CountryCode LK|LKA|USA;
+
